VIDEO: Trumpa izžvižgali kot še nikoli, televizija prekinila prenos
Trump v prestolnici ni bil nikoli popularen, na volitvah leta 2016 je tam dobil le štiri odstotke glasov.
03 Nov 2019, 13:44 by P. K.
WASHINGTON – Ameriški predsednik Donald Trump se je pred dnevi prvič po nastopu predsedniške funkcije odpravil na ogled tekme bejzbola, kamor je povabil še nekaj ranjenih veteranov, kongresnih podpornikov in prvo damo Melanio Trump. Ko so ga organizatorji predstavili publiki, ga je ta glasno izžvižgala in zahtevala, da ga zaprejo. Trump je prišel na tekmo šele po prvi menjavi, na zaslonu pa so ga pokazali in razglasili šele po tretji menjavi, ko ekipa Washingtona običajno opravi pozdrav za vojaške veterane. Ko se je na pokazala Trumpova loža, so se oglasili žvižgi in glasni izrazi neodobravanja. Na zaslonu so nato prikazali veterane, kar je poželo aplavz.



Tik pred začetkom četrte menjave pa so se s tribun zaslišali vzkliki: »Zaprite ga, zaprite ga!« Televizija Fox v neposrednem prenosu incidenta ni pokazala, ampak je predvajala oglase.Bejzbol je najbolj ameriški šport, ki za množice drugje, razen morda na Kubi, ni privlačen. Zgodovinska statistika kaže, da so vsi ameriški predsedniki od leta 1910 naprej zalučali ceremonialno prvo žogico na vsaj eni od tekem lige: ali ob odprtju sezone ali na tekmi vseh zvezd ali na eni od tekem finala, ki se igra na štiri zmage. Prvi je to storil William Taft, ki ni ravno slovel po vitkosti. Trump, ki se je večkrat hvalil, da je bil v mladosti tako dober, da bi lahko postal poklicni igralec bejzbola, pa tega ni storil.Uradno zato, ker je imel v načrtu obisk le pete tekme finala med domačo ekipo Nationals in gosti iz teksaškega Houstona (Astros), za katero je bil izvajalec ceremonialnega meta že izbran. Komiki, ki ga ne marajo, pa trdijo, da ni sposoben vreči žogice tistih 15 metrov od metalca do odbijalca.Trump v prestolnici ni bil nikoli popularen, na volitvah leta 2016 je tam dobil le štiri odstotke glasov. Pred tekmo je predstavnik družine Lerner, ki je lastnik ekipe Washington Nationals, zaprosil vodstvo lige, naj jih ne spravi v neroden položaj, ko bi morali zavrniti prošnjo Bele hiše, da Trumpa namestijo v njihovi loži.

VIDEO: Trump whistled like never before, television cut off the transmission
Trump has never been popular in the capital, winning only four percent of the vote in the 2016 election.
03 Nov 2019, 12:44 by P.K.
WASHINGTON - A few days ago, US President Donald Trump set out to watch a baseball game, inviting a few more injured veterans, congressional supporters, and First Lady Melania Trump, just after his presidency. When presented to the audience by the organizers, the crowd whistled loudly and demanded that they close it. Trump came to the game only after the first exchange, and was shown and announced on the screen only after the third exchange, when the Washington team usually makes a salute for military veterans. When the Trump Lodge showed up, whistles and loud expressions of disapproval sounded. The screen then showed veterans, which erupted in applause.



Shortly before the start of the fourth exchange, exclamations were heard from the stands, "Shut it up, shut it up!" , is not attractive. Historical statistics show that from 1910 onwards, all US presidents slammed the ceremonial first ball in at least one of the league games: either at the opening of the season or at an all-star game or in one of the matches of the finals, which is played to four victories. The first was done by William Taft, who did not exactly renown for leanness. Trump, who boasted repeatedly that he was so good at a young age that he could become a baseball player, did not do so because he planned to attend only the fifth game of the finals between the Nationals and the Texas native Houston (Astros), for whom the ceremonial throw contractor has already been selected. Comedians who dislike him claim he is incapable of throwing the ball 15 feet from the thrower to the bumper. Trump was never popular in the capital, winning only four percent of the vote in the 2016 election. Before the game, a representative from the Washington Nationals-owned Lerner family asked the league's leadership not to embarrass them when they had to reject a White House request to place Trump in their lodge.
